instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
The board draws 5.17v 0.00A 
I found short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SPKRAMP</SIGNAL> and knocked off CR636 short gone... still no power 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>=0V 
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC1_LDO_CORE</SIGNAL>=1.5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC1_LDO</SIGNAL>=3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC0_LDO_CORE</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC0_LDO</SIGNAL>=0V.
And board still draws 5.17v 0.00A

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message: Post <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, PBUS, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>=5.17V
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>=is between 1.1and 1.2V
VDDA/P=5.1V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>=0V
PBUS=1.1v
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>=5.1V
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>=0.705
A/BMON=0V
I knocked off <RESISTOR>R5275</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5257</CAPACITOR> they are corroded

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5275</RESISTOR> is critical.
<CAPACITOR>C5257</CAPACITOR> can't stop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> generation.

Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C5230</CAPACITOR>/40 are good, as traces too.
You may need to change <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> and/or <TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40.

Check <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> voltage, removing F5200.
